sen.j: 律令制下において六位は下国の国司及び国府の次官である介が叙せられる位であった。
sen.e: Under the ritsuryo system, Rokui (Sixth Rank) was conferred on Kokushi (provincial governors) of Gekoku (minor provinces) as well as on Suke (assistant provincial governor) who was Suke (assistant director) of Kokufu (provincial office).

sen.j: 地下人の位階とされ、五位以上の貴族（通貴）とは一線を画する位階であり昇殿は許されなかった。
sen.e: Rokui was the Ikai for Jigenin (a lower rank of ancient Japanese nobility), which was demarcated from the nobles (Tsuki [intermediate ranking nobles]) with Goi (Fifth Rank) or higher, and was not allowed to enter the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 明治時代以降は、少佐の階級にある者などがこの位に叙せられた。
sen.e: After the Meji period, people with the military rank of lieutenant commander were conferred to this rank.
